page.title: 20Schooldays in Coatham 1905
page.content:
There were 7 or 8 teachers in the school and Mrs Tate clearly remembered her headmaster Mr. "Gaffer" Jones, who was a good teacher. She told the story of him chasing one of the Warrenby boys over desks with his cane! You got the cane for many things including being late.
There was no uniform but the majority of the girls wore white pinafores. Writing was done on slate boards with slate pencils. They always tried to get the sharpest pencil and the cleanest slates. Grooves can still be seen in the stone work where this happened.
When Mrs Tate arrived at the school she was able to read so she had to teach the Warrenby boys how to read.
